DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study investigate safety tolerability JNJ-54175446 versus placebo single oral dose administration ( ascend dose level ) , determine maximal tolerate dose ( MTD ) safety tolerability exposure result full target engagement least 24 hour participant ( whichever come first ) , characterize pharmacokinetics JNJ-54175446 plasma , cerebrospinal fluid ( CSF ) urine investigate effect food ( high fat/high calorie ) pharmacokinetics JNJ 54175446 single oral dose administration .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Investigate Safety Tolerability , Pharmacokinetics , Pharmacodynamics Food Effect JNJ-54175446 Healthy Participants
DOC.detailed_description: This double-blind , placebo-controlled , randomize , single ascend dose study healthy participant JNJ-54175446 . The study consist 3 phase : screening phase ( 21 2 day prior dose administration ) , double-blind treatment phase ( 8 day ; Part 1 Part 3 ) open-label treatment phase ( 8 day ; Part 2 ) , follow-up examination ( within 14 21 day dose administration ) . The maximal study duration participant exceed 6 week . In cohort Part 1 ( 6 cohort ) Part 3 ( 1 cohort ) , participant randomly assign receive JNJ-54175446 matching placebo cohort part 2 , participant assign JNJ-54175446 treatment . In part 1 , primarily maximum tolerate dose ( MTD ) assess , along safety tolerability JNJ-54175446 . In part 2 , pharmacokinetics ( PK ) JNJ-54175446 cerebrospinal fluid ( CSF ) assess . In part 3 , effect food plasma PK JNJ-54175446 young healthy male participant assess . Safety monitor throughout study .
DOC.criteria: Participants must body mass index ( BMI ) 18 32 kg/m^2 , inclusive ( BMI = weight/height^2 ) Participants must healthy basis clinical laboratory test perform screen . If result serum chemistry panel [ exclude liver function test ] , hematology , urinalysis outside normal reference range , participant may include investigator judge abnormality clinically significant . This determination must record subject 's source document initial investigator A man sexually active woman childbearing potential vasectomy must agree use barrier method birth control e.g. , either condom spermicidal foam/gel/film/cream/suppository partner occlusive cap ( diaphragm cervical/vault cap ) spermicidal foam/gel/film/cream/suppository , men must also donate sperm study 3 month receive last dose study drug . In addition , female partner also use appropriate method birth control least duration For Part 1 3 : Healthy male participant 18 54 year age , inclusive For Part 2 : Healthy male female participant 55 75 year age , inclusive Participant must healthy basis physical neurological examination perform screening admission clinical unit Women must childbearing potential ( i.e. , must postmenopausal amenorrhea least 12 month ) ; permanently sterilize ( e.g. , tubal occlusion , hysterectomy , bilateral salpingectomy ) ; otherwise incapable pregnancy Participant history current liver renal insufficiency ; significant cardiac , vascular , pulmonary , gastrointestinal , endocrine , neurologic , hematologic ( include coagulation disorder ) , rheumatologic , psychiatric , metabolic disturbance , inflammatory illness illness Investigator considers exclude participant Participant liver function test ( include alanine aminotransferase [ ALT ] , aspartate aminotransferase [ AST ] , gammaglutamyltransferase [ gammaGT ] , alkaline phosphatase [ ALP ] bilirubin ) screen exceed upper limit normal Participant history hepatitis B surface antigen ( HBsAg ) hepatitis C antibody ( antiHCV ) positive , clinically active liver disease , test positive HBsAg antiHCV Screening Participant history human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) antibody positive , test positive HIV Screening Participant Prothrombin time [ PT ] > 14 second and/or activate partial thromboplastin time [ aPTT ] > 35 second
